name: Red Imperial Astromech Droids
notes:
The Red loot droids can be found in random locations across the entire map, including inside wrecked cars and on top of buildings. 

To unlock it you need a Red Datacard. 

  • The Red Datacards are created by combining a matching Red Star Map with an Empty Datacard.
  • Star Maps and Empty Datacards can both be found inside the Imperial Bunker in the toxic zone.
  • Empty Datacards can also be found as loot on red or black B1 Battle Droids.
  • The Datacard is single-use and will be ruined after you unlock the droid.

The Red droids typically drop:

  • One or two pieces of character armor sets (Captain Phasma, Darth Talon)
  • A regular or Overkill lightsaber
  • A single Jedi or Sith Medallion
  • Random T2 armor pieces (Cpt. Rex Helmet, Bad Batch, Republic Commando or Purge Trooper armor pieces)

name: Green Imperial Astromech Droids
notes:
The Green loot droids can be found in random locations across the entire map, including at tie crashes and inside buildings. 

To unlock it you need a Green Datacard. 

  • The Green Datacards are created by combining a Green Star Map with an Empty Datacard.
  • Star Maps and Empty Datacards can both be found inside the Imperial Bunker in the toxic zone.
  • Empty Datacards can also be found as loot on red or black B1 Battle Droids.
  • The Datacard is single-use and will be ruined after you unlock the droid.

The Green droids typically drop:

  • One or two pieces of character armor sets (Captain Phasma)
  • A regular or Overkill lightsaber
  • A single Jedi or Sith Medallion
  • Random T2 armor pieces (Purge Trooper, Arc Trooper, Bad Batch armor pieces)

name: Black Imperial Astromech Droids
notes:
The Black loot droids can be found in random locations across the entire map, including inside military barracks and nests. 

 

To unlock it you need a Black Datacard.

 

  • The Black datacards are found as ground loot inside the locked portion of the Sith Temple.
  • The Sith Temple is unlocked with a Sith Holocron.
  • A Sith Holocron is created by combining 2 Sith Kyber Crystals.
  • Sith Kyber Crystals can be found in the Imperial Bunker in the toxic zone.
  • The Datacard is single use and will be ruined after you unlock the droid.

 

The Black droids typically drop:

  • One of the 2 Gray Jedi full sets
  • A Jedi and/or Sith Medallion

name: BB9E Loot Droids
notes:
The BB9E loot droids can be found in random locations across the entire map, including inside military encampments and industrial areas. They are very small and can be easy to overlook.

 

To unlock it you need a Gray Datacard.

 

  • The Gray datacards are found as ground loot inside the locked portion of the Jedi Temple.
  • The Jedi Temple is unlocked with a Jedi Holocron.
  • A Jedi Holocron is created by combining 2 Jedi Kyber Crystals.
  • Jedi Kyber Crystals can be found in the Imperial Bunker in the toxic zone.

  • The Datacard is single use and will be ruined after you unlock the droid.

     

The BB9E droids typically drop:

  • One full Sith set (Darth Vader, Darth Nihilus, etc). Note: If you find the Darth Vader set, it will also include the Darth Vader Interrigation Droid which is a 200 slot shoulder storage item similar to the Probe Droids
  • A Jedi and/or Sith Medallion
  • 25 Trade Federation Coins

name: Mando Safe
notes:
These trashcan looking loot crates can be found in random locations across the entire map, including inside miltary bases and at Tie Fighter crashes.

 

To unlock it you need an Activated Chaincode.

 

  • Activated Chaincodes are created by combining a Chaincode with a Datapad.
  • The Chaincode and Datapad both drop from the cargo holds of the random spawning Krennic or Razorcrest ships.
  • You will find these ships guarded by 4-7 Death Troopers.
  • If you enter the ship and tab, you'll see a 300 slot cargo hold.
  • The Datapad or Chaincode will be the only item in it. If it is empty, another player has already looted it and it will not respawn in that instance of the ship.

 

Mando Safes typically contain:

  • A full character armor set (Andromeda, Sabine Wren, Bo Katan, Ahsoka Tano, Battle Droid)
  • A random piece of a secondary character armor set. (ND5_Droid)

name: Jawa Sandcrawlers
notes:
You can find Jawa Sandcrawlers on top of the mountain ridges and in the deserts across of the map. 

 

  • These Sandcrawlers are a reliable source of Charcoal tabs, which are used to refill the gas filters needed to traverse the Imperial bunker in the toxic zone.
  • Inside the Sandcrawlers you'll find 3 crates, and one usually has at least one charcoal tab on it. 

 

As a bonus, some Sandcrawlers are sometimes guarded by hostile Jawas. These Jawas can sometimes drop a rare item called a Jawa Cloak which, when worn, makes you appear to be an oversized Jawa.

name: Imperial Bunker
notes:
The Imperial Bunker is located in the toxic zone in the north-western quadrant of the map.

 

Requirement to access the bunker:

  • An Imperial Keycard
    • Imperial Keycards can be found as ground loot in PVP zones, they can drop as loot on NPC enemies, and be hidden inside crates from admin events.
  • A full gas protection suit (hood, jacket, pants, gloves, boots).
  • NBC set pieces and Chewy set pieces can be mixed and matched
  • A respirator
  • Gas filters
    • Gas filters can be refilled using charcoal tablets.
    • Charcoal tablets are found everywhere, most commonly in Jawa Sandcrawlers or medical buildings.
    • You can craft an improvised gas filter by combining a water bottle and a Dust Mask. The improvised gas filter does not last as long as the standard one.

 

 

The entrance to the bunker is on the west side of the building, and is guarded by a powerful General Grievous NPC.

To gain entry, approach the entrance with your Imperial Keycard in your hand and activate the console.

You will be teleported inside the airlock. With the Keycard still in your hand, activate the codepad on the left hand side of the bunker door.

To exit the bunker, activate the matching console found on the catwalk in the hangar bay at the far end of the bunker.

 

 The interactive map can be used to familiarize yourself with the layout of the bunker. Click on a room to view a screenshot.

 

The Imperial Bunker contains:

  • Sith, Jedi, Pink and Orange Kyber Crystals
  • Red, Green & Blue Star Maps
  • Empty Datacards
  • BD2 and Yoda Backpacks (250 slots)
  • Droid Backpacks (150 slots)
  • Commander Cody, Bly and Wolffe sets
  • DLT19, Firepuncher and Mandalorian Rifles
  • Regular and Overkill Lightsabers
  • Gas Filters
  • Trade Federation Coins
